# TESS Program G05071

Title: White Dwarfs In Binaries - A Unique Probe Of Stellar And Planetary Astrophysics

PI: Martin, David - Ohio State University

Type: SMALL

Summary: Binaries are nature's astrophysics laboratory. We propose a unique TESS application to a carefully constructed sample of 4063 wide binaries which contain at least one white dwarf. We will be sensitive to transits not only on the main sequence star, but also on the white dwarf, owing to TESS's 20 second cadence. For exoplanetary science our predicted 10-20 discoveries will probe how the evolution of planets connects with that of their stars, including classic white dwarf signatures such as heavy element pollution. For stellar physics our sample will permit calibration of stellar age dating techniques (asteroseismology, gyrochronology and isochrones) with white dwarf cooling ages, permitting significant advances in this burgeoning yet challenging field.


# Sector 056 targets observed (2 min: 70, 20 s: 29)
